channel.title: LFO falling and rising values
channel.description:
I am sure I have read it in one of the posts somewhere but can't find any more, I am looking for a way to detect weather the LFO is in its falling or rising part of its cycle, and separate the values from each.
Is there any easy way of doing this ?
The only thing I can think of is to compare the difference between the current value to the previous value, and weather it is negative or positive.. but this is something I am hopping to avoid.
Thanks..

item.title: LFO falling and rising values
item.dc:creator: @Gavin Gavin
item.description:
@Gavin wrote:

Excellent.
Will give it a try..

Read full topic

item.title: LFO falling and rising values
item.dc:creator: @johannes johannes
item.description:
@johannes wrote:

Gavin:

The only thing I can think of is to compare the difference between the current value to the previous value, and weather it is negative or positive.. but this is something I am hopping to avoid.

"filter/delta" followed by "conv/to b" should do.

Read full topic

item.title: LFO falling and rising values

item.description:
@toneburst wrote:

I can't think of any other way of doing it.

a|x
